H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3124.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3124.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H8659.def: = (semi-)precious stone, possibly kind of beryl, which is colorless in its pure form

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H7939.def: = a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H4419.def: = a person who works as a member of the crew of ship or boat

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
